title: target
description: Each target contains some base properties that are common across all targets. These properties are defined in the following table. The ID for each target is stored as the key in the 'targets' dictionary.

type.description: The type of target object being used. The value of this property SHOULD come from the 'target-type-ov' vocabulary.

name.description: The name that represents this target that is meant to be displayed in a user interface or captured in a log message.

description.description: More details, context, and possibly an explanation about this target.

target_extensions.description: This property defines the extensions that are in use on this target. The key for each entry in the dictionary MUST be an 'identifier' that uniquely identifies the extension (see section 9.8 for more information on identifiers). The value for each key is a JSON object that can contain the structure as defined in the extension definition's schema property.
